attributes.action: End institutional care for children: orphanages and children's homes
attributes.additional_details:
75% of children in care live in Foster Homes costing the Country £1.5 Billion, however, 25% of children in care who live in children's homes costs the Country £1 Billion (2012-2013), but early figures show this is close to £3 Billion in 2017.

https://www.nao.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/Children-in-care1.pdf

“If we focus on inspiring the younger generations with positive experiences, we won’t have to reprimand them when they are older through the Criminal Justice System.” April Chandler
attributes.background: Over 55% of those in the care system end up in the prison system, are vulnerable for human trafficking, prostitution, drugs, alcohol abuse and teenage pregnancy, plus, 40% of care leavers are not in education, employment or training at age 19 compared to 11% of the general population.

rejection.details:
We understand that you're concerned about institutional car for children, but we're not sure what alternative care you'd like the Government to put in place. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
